title: 104_hr1024
content: The text amends various sections by replacing "Joint Committee on Printing" with different committees like "Committee on Rules and Administration of the House of Representatives" and "Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives". It also replaces "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in the Federal Water Power Act. The text further amends various sections by replacing "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in different acts such as the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 and title 28 of the United States Code. The text amends different sections by replacing "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in various acts and codes, including title 28, title 40, and title 44 of the United States Code. Title 44 Amendments: The table of chapters for title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing the item related to chapter 1. Section 305(a) of title 44 is amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" and to change the appeal process to be under subchapter III of chapter 71 of title 5. Section 309(a) of title 44, United States Code, is amended by replacing "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer". Section 312 is amended by removing the approval requirement of the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 502 and 504 are also amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 504 of title 44, United States Code is amended to change the authority from the Joint Committee on Printing to the Public Printer. Section 505 is amended to remove regulations of the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 508 is amended to replace the Joint Committee on Printing with the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. Section 509 is also amended. Section 509 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" and remove the phrase ", under their direction." Section 510 is also amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer." Section 511 is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in the first sentence. Section 512 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in the first and second sentences. Section 513 and 514 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the "Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in specified sentences. Section 514 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer" in specified sentences. Section 517 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace the authority of the Joint Committee on Printing with that of the Public Printer. Section 702 is also amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" for consistency. Section 703 undergoes similar changes. Section 703 of title 44, United States Code is amended by replacing the authority of the Joint Committee on Printing with the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate or the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. Section 707 is also amended to remove the authority of the Joint Committee on Printing to authorize the printing of bills or resolutions. The authority of the Joint Committee on Printing to authorize the printing of bills or resolutions is replaced by the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, to determine the style and form of printing until final enactment in both Houses of Congress. The Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, is given the authority to determine the style and form of printing until final enactment in both Houses of Congress. Amendments are made to sections 709 and 714 of title 44, United States Code, regarding the roles and responsibilities of the Public Printer. The Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, establishes rules for sections 717 and 718 of title 44, United States Code. Section 721(a) of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 722 of title 44, United States Code, is also amended. Section 723 of title 44, United States Code, is further amended by replacing references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 724 and Section 728 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 738 and Section 901 of title 44, United States Code, are also amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 738 and Section 901 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Additionally, Section 902 and Section 903 of title 44 are amended in a similar manner. Section 905 and Section 906 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. The text amends Section 905 and Section 906 of title 44, United States Code, by changing references to the Joint Committee on Printing to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives for distribution of copies to committees in Congress. The text amends Section 905 and Section 906 of title 44, United States Code, by changing references to the Joint Committee on Printing to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives for distribution of copies to committees in Congress. The changes include providing ten semimonthly copies to the designated committees. The text amends Section 905 and Section 906 of title 44, United States Code, by changing references to the Joint Committee on Printing to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives for distribution of copies to committees in Congress. It includes providing ten semimonthly copies to the designated committees, with specific guidelines for binding and delivery. The text further amends various sections of title 44, United States Code, by replacing references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer for certain functions related to the supply and delivery of copies. The text amends sections of title 44, United States Code by replacing references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer for certain functions related to the supply and delivery of copies. Section 1338 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer for certain functions related to the supply and delivery of copies. Section 1705, 1710, and 1914 of title 44, United States Code are amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing and replace them with the Public Printer. In amendments to title 44, United States Code, references to the Joint Committee on Printing are removed and replaced with the Public Printer. This includes changes in sections 1914 and 5(b) of the Federal Records Management Amendments of 1976. The Act and its amendments will take effect on the first day of the 9th month after enactment, unless otherwise specified.
